alert.note: Alert for Lower St. Martin; St. Mary (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lake Charles (Southeast Texas and Southwest Louisiana)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 26 at 7:09PM CDT by NWS Lake Charles
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of St. Mary Parish through 800 PM CDT... At 709 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Franklin, moving south at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Morgan City, Franklin, Patterson, Berwick, Burns Point, Bayou Vista, Baldwin, Ellerslie, Patterson Memorial Airport, Charenton and Centerville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
